newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel's Elta wins $115 million Swiss contract.
newsitem.headline: Israel's Elta wins $115 million Swiss contract.

text.p: Israel's Elta Electronics Industries Ltd said on Wednesday that it had won a $115 million contract from the government of Switzerland for communications intelligence systems (comint).

The equipment, which will supplied over three years or more, will be used by the Swiss army as part of its programme to improve comint capabilities, said Elta, a wholly owned subsidiary of state-owned Israel Aircraft Industries Ltd.

The equipment is used for detecting, intercepting and analyzing communications traffic and employs advanced embedded digital spectrum-processing technology. A prototype system was ordered by the Swiss in 1992 and subsequent improvements were developed in cooperation with the Swiss army, an Elta spokesman said.
